narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Much better than nat. sci. class, although amazingly less rigorous.
This class is THE most useful class for my research--a social research project. Prof. Doolittle is amazing and I strongly recommend her class. She is a very good person, too.
readings complemented each other very well and gave different perspectives on the weekly topic.

Question 7C: I did wish that the TA had been more engaged in class discussions; she rarely spoke out, and did not provide comments on final student presentations. Her thoughts would have been valuable, as a second year who has gone through this process already.
A mixed methods class would be more useful for some MESc students using both natural and social science research methods
Openness to discussion by classmates and ta and professor. Time to talk about research and hear about other's research.
Interesting students and a good opportunity to learn what one's colleagues are working on/interested in. Also, a good opportunity for direction/feedback on your research from the Prof.
It was an opportunity to develop your research ideas and write a sample proposal for funding.
Developing my research with personal weekly attention from trained social scientist.
The assignments that required us to create / administer a survey and to conduct an interview.
Teaching all you need to start your research
The assignments and outputs were practical and useful. It was great to discuss research project ideas with classmates.
1. The practical research exercises2. The peer group review of research topics and proposals

As someone new to social science research, assignments that required us to actually practice the methods were very helpful. While only so much can be covered in one semester, practicing and receiving feedback on first tries at surveying, interviewing, coding, etc. were valuable.

The out of class practical assignments were all incredibly useful and fun. In particular, I enjoyed the interview and coding assignment - both the exercise itself and the class discussion that followed were rich and edifying.

The class allowed me the time to focus on my project and gain valuable feedback from my peers and the instructor. Additionally, the instructor's flexibility really allowed the students to shape the course to their collective needs.
Roundtable discussion, instructor, lectures

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: This course was billed as a qualitative methods course in social sciences, but it turned out to be a course about anthropological qualitative methods. Although the instructor was open to discussing other perspectives, she did not provide any readings or teachings incorporating other perspectives. This is a course that should feature a variety of approaches to qualitative methods and should also feature guest lecturers from across FES and Yale.
Lectures seemed relatively haphazard and unprepared.
Having students present readings that no one else has read in advance was kind of a waste of time.
Lectures. The instructor spoke too quickly, oftentimes preparing more information that could be successfully completed in one class period.
- readings sometimes don't match up too well with the lectures.- the article presentations were often a waste of time / hard to follow without having read the article oneself.
We could have used more time dedicated to discussing research project ideas with classmates. At times the teacher seemed disorganized and scattered.
1. Overall the course was great, an area of improvement can be including some more practical sessions in class.

Breaking out into groups to discuss research was helpful, but class discussions felt thin. I think it would have been helpful to bring the readings into discussions, discussing the issues they address, andanalyzing the methods of the papers and considering discrepancies or differences in methodological approaches.Many of us were hearing about our classmates' research for the first time during the end of semester presentations, not having been in break-out groups with them. I would have felt much more able to comment/make suggestions about classmates' research if we had all submitted a synopsis of some sort on classes V2 before the presentations.Based on my conversations with other members of the class, I think some of us felt that we needed more guidance with certain practical elements of the process of developing a research project, especially with regard to making on the ground contacts.The guest lecture on statistical software was not very helpful, and I think an overview of the various statistical options for data analysis, and which methods are appropriate for which kind of data, would have been more beneficial.

The research article presentations could probably be dropped. Although going through the analysis itself was useful, listening to everyone's presentations was not particularly interesting or useful, and it took away from class discussion time.
Improved scheduling and time management would benefit the class. For example, the assigned readings (which were very interesting) were hardly discussed in through out the semester.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The instructor and TA were very available and helpful, save for the fact that their specialization was in the field of anthropology only.
Extremely available!

Both the Professor and the TA were very accessible and helpful. And nice. Also, though I thought the class was not very well organized and sometimes seemed like not the best way to spend my time, the prof. was often available and provided helpful feedback, ideas, etc. So while the class itself maybe wasn't so great, it did provide the opportunity for valuable interaction with a knowledgeable and generous Professor.
Both were extremely available and supportive.
Professor was always available through office hours.
Wonderful
TA was very helpful.
Both instructor and TA always made themselves available for help.
I contacted both the instructor and TA.The instructor seemed always busy - and preoccupied with other things.The TA was more helpful to me!
Both Amity and Nike were very available and responsive.

I probably received more help from the instructor in this class than from the instructors in my other three classes combined; she was extremely available and accessible, and always provided advise that was both helpful and reassuring.
Both TA and instructor were readily available. This truly enhanced the class.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Good intro for me into soc. science research methods. This I simply did not get at all for the natural science research methods (in 550 class)
It's a requirement for my degree.
It is preparing me for my summer research.
It's a required course for the MESc program. In order to conduct summer research, it's necessary to understand methods.
I strongly recommend anyone who is doing social science research to take this class, even though you are not a MESc student.
It was great to produce a proposal that I will actually use to solicit funds for my research.
It has helped me to produce a proposal towards my summer research. The course has helped me to build research techniques and skills
As I am doing a research degree, this course is invaluable to my program.
The course fits very well into my MESc degree. It provided me the much needed time to focus on my Master's project and learn about applicable research techniques.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Requirement and needed intro to soc. sci.
It's a requirement for my degree.
To prepare my research design
Required, but also a necessity.
required.
I am a MESc student.
as a requirement and also because it was relevant to my research project
I took this course to learn about social science research methods to round out my biological sci. research methods.
I wanted a grad understanding of social science research methods.
see above

1) Essential for those planning to undertake social science research during the summer2) Advisor recommended it3) Course was extremely well designed with a good balance between learning the theory of social science research and gaining practice with using the methods through out of class assignments4) Amity makes life better
I took this course to focus on developing my Master's project proposal.
MESc requirement

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: I wanted this course to provide me with some training in qualitative methods generally not anthropological methods and as such it has been a bit of a disappointment in this regard.
Yes
I didn't really go in with any expectations in particular. I took this class because it's required.
Mostly
Yes.
yes
More yes than no.
Yes.
yes
Yes.Not only did I gain skills in useful methods, I'm very happy with how my summer research project has developed and evolved.
Overall, the course did live up to my expectations. It gave the class ample time to discuss our individual projects, and gain valuable comment on our ideas.
Yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes

See above. This class was a worthwhile experience, but I think it could be improved. Presented material could be better organized. Having student present papers that no one has read was not a good use of time.
Yes
Yes.
yes. the hands-on assignments were very helpful.
Yes. I love this class
yes
More yes than no.
Yes I did
yes

In a way, I expected the course to be a repeat of my senior thesis seminar as an undergraduate - where by the end of the semester, I could give an elevator speech on each of my classmates' research projects, and we were all very good friends. Although this research methods course was amazing and by far my favorite course this semester, it wasn't quite the student bonding experience I thought it would be.
Yes.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Great discussions amongst other students!
Our work groups were informal and outside of class. The amount of camaraderie and support for each other fostered and supported through this class was exactly why I came to FES.
We had group discussion in class. Veryuseful.

There were some self-organized and impromptu discussions outside class for everyone to continue talking about their research with classmates. Although this was symptomatic of not having enough time during class to talk, I think ultimately it was a good incentive for us to organize outside class ... to form the habit of meeting and discussing together well after the semester ends.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Only take this course if you intend to use anthropological methods in your research.
Take this over natural sci., unless you absolutely know you are a nat. sci. researcher
Take advantage of the opportunity to explore research questions with your classmates and get feedback.
Take full advantage of Amity's office hours, she is a great resource for research development.
Go to office hours when you need help.
Try to devote yourself as much as possible. It will pay off!
Don't buy the textbook -- rent from library.
Try to decide your research topic on time so as to be able to get the best out of the class.
talk to second year students as much as possible about the research process. Speak with Amity in office hours.

Even though there is freedom to change your mind, explore and tweak your research ideas throughout the semester, be careful. There is a fine line between abusing this freedom to wander into a hallucinatory maze of alternative possibilities versus using the time to refine your ideas. Ultimately, you'll get more benefit from the course if you make up your mind early.

This course will definitely benefit you if you are planning on developing a project for the following summer. Begin drafting your project proposal early. Even if it changes, this exercise is invaluable, and it will give you pertinent questions to bring up in class.
Come in with a strong idea of what you want to research
